page.title: 07Pulham's Coaches
page.content: Since the closure of the railway line through{Bourton-on-the-Water}in 1961 the only{public transport}in the area has been provided by{Pulham's Coaches. During this time local bus services have increased by 25% and Mr Pulham now has{25 coaches.}The firm began in 1880 as a local carrier with horse and van and has remained a family business. Today, in addition to local services and private hire, there are about{10 excursions}to the{continent } each year and{50 day outings}to other parts of the country. Mr Pulham runs regular services to{Cheltenham, {Cirencester, Banbury, Stratford-upon- {Avon and Moreton-in-Marsh.}There is a daily commuter service into Cheltenham and 5 buses a day between Bourton and{Little Rissington. Wyck {Rissington}is without a bus service, but all except one family own a car.
